player: DeAndre Bembry (personal) will not play Saturday vs. Mavs.
Now that the trade has been completed, Mike Dunleavy is expected to join the Hawks soon but will not play for Atlanta on Saturday vs. Dallas.
Mike Scott did not play in the D-League on Wednesday due to lower left leg muscle soreness.
Tiago Splitter will miss at least six more weeks with a right calf strain.
Trevor Booker (hip) returned to Sunday's loss to the 76ers and finished with four points, four rebounds, three assists, one steal and one block in 18 minutes.
Jeremy Lin (hamstring) has been ruled out for Sunday against the 76ers.
Avery Bradley (strained Achilles) is out for Saturday night against the Pelicans.
James Young (ankle) will not play for at least one more week.
Tyler Zeller (illness) will not play against the Pelicans on Saturday.
The Hornets confirmed that Nicolas Batum hyperextended his right knee and will not play Saturday at San Antonio.
Denzel Valentine (ankle) will not play Saturday vs. the Raptors.
Kyle Korver is not expected to play on Sunday vs. the Suns.
J.R. Smith’s thumb surgery was completed on Friday morning and the Cavs announced his "return to play timeline is currently projected at 12-14 weeks."
Chris Anderson suffered a torn ACL in his right knee and will be out for the rest of the season.
Gary Harris (groin) is a late scratch against the Thunder on Saturday.
Nikola Jokic (illness) will not play against the Thunder on Saturday.
Michael Gbinije (right forearm bruise) is listed as questionable for Saturday's game in Portland.
Aron Baynes (ankle) went through shootaround on Saturday and remains questionable to face the Blazers.
Reggie Bullock (knee) returned to practice on Wednesday.
The Rockets have confirmed that Clint Capela has a small fracture in his left fibula and will be re-evaluated in approximately four weeks.
As expected, Rodney Stuckey (hamstring) has been ruled out of Saturday's game vs. the Knicks.
Austin Rivers (illness) will not play on Sunday vs. the Heat.
Blake Griffin (knee) had a routine follow-up examination on Thursday and coach Doc Rivers said Griffin "looked great" and is making progress.
Brice Johnson (back) will not play opening night.
The Lakers expect Larry Nance (knee) to return in about two weeks.
Deyonta Davis suffered a torn plantar fascia and will miss 6-8 weeks.
Brandan Wright underwent arthroscopic ankle surgery on Tuesday and is out indefinitely.
Luke Babbitt (illness) has been ruled out for Sunday's game against the Clippers.
Josh Richardson (sprained left foot) and Luke Babbitt (illness) will not play Sunday vs. the Clippers.
Justise Winslow (right shoulder) had surgery to repair a torn labrum on Thursday and is expected to miss the rest of the season.
Hassan Whiteside (eye, personal) will return to the starting lineup for Sunday's game against the Clippers.
Josh McRoberts (stress reaction in left foot) is out indefinitely, according to coach Erik Spoelstra.
Nikola Pekovic hinted that he may retire from the game of basketball.
Michael Beasley exited Sunday's game with a left shin contusion and did not return, ending his evening with 18 points, one rebound, one steal, one 3-pointer and one turnover in 16 minutes.
Giannis Antetokounmpo (illness) will not play on Sunday vs. the Wizards.
Rashad Vaughn (left ankle sprain) said he's likely going to be out a "couple of weeks."
Khris Middleton (hamstring) said he's not running at full speed yet.
Quincy Pondexter underwent successful arthroscopic left knee surgery on Wednesday morning.
Sergio Rodriguez (ankle) logged 12 minutes off the bench in his return to action on Sunday, hitting 2-of-6 shots on his way to four points, three assists and one turnover.
The 76ers have recalled Richaun Holmes (concussion) from the D-League.
Jerryd Bayless (left wrist) had surgery on Thursday and is expected to miss the rest of the season.
Ben Simmons (foot) did some on-court work at T.D. Garden before Friday's game against the Celtics.
Festus Ezeli (knee) is likely to undergo season-ending surgery.
David Lee (left knee contusion) will not play Saturday vs. the Hornets.
Patrick Patterson (knee) will play vs. the Rockets on Sunday.
Jared Sullinger (foot) was getting shots up before Thursday's game against the Jazz.
Delon Wright (shoulder) is back to doing on-court work.
Ian Mahinmi (knees) will be evaluated late in January before a return date can be established.
Danuel House (wrist) suffered a fractured right wrist.
